history.content:
We're running our summer undergraduate research program again this year.

Last summer we started with 22 Berkeley undergrad students, mostly just after their freshman

and sophomore years, doing research on micro robots and wireless sensor networks.

There were projects in software and hardware.

We ended up with 5 research publications written by undergrads (see below),
and I paid for those undergrads to travel and present their work in San Diego,
Dublin Ireland, Barcelona Spain, and Brisbane Australia.  There were many other
students projects that were very successful as well.
If you're interested, send me an email with the dates that you will be available,
the kind of project that you are interested in, and a resume and transcript if you
have them handy.  Here's a partial list of projects:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/10QOTOdRHPRNv8M1ZBR67dzH3_-igb5s71VLip08cXMw/edit?usp=sharing
Kris Pister
Prof. EECS, pister@eecs.berkeley.edu
--------------
Summer 2017 publications written by undergrads:
Brian Yang, Grant Wang, Roberto Calandra, Daniel Contreras, Sergey Levine, and Kristofer Pister
"Learning Flexible and Reusable Locomotion Primitives for a Microrobot",
Int. Conf. on Robotics and Automation, ICRA 2018
and
IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters, Jan 2018.
 
Brian Yang, Grant Wang, Roberto Calandra, Daniel Contreras, Sergey Levine, and Kristofer Pister
"Learning Flexible and Reusable Locomotion Primitives for a Microrobot",
31st Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NIPS 2017).
Alex Yang, Arvind Sundararajan, Craig Schindler, Kris Pister, 
"Analysis of Low Latency TSCH Networks for Physical Event Detection",
Time Critical Cyber Physical Systems, IEEE WCNC 2018.
R.M. Shih, D.S. Contreras, T.L. Massey, J.T. Greenspun, and K.S.J. Pister,
"Characterization of Electrostatic Gap-Closing Actuator Arrays in Aqueous Conditions",
MEMS 2018.
